official-title.#text:
To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to strengthen Federal-State partnerships in postsecondary
			 education.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#text: Mr. Danny K. Davis of Illinois

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Partnerships for Affordability and Student Success Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Partnerships for Affordability and Student Success Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 137 of the Higher Education Act of 1965

header.#text: State commitment to affordable college education

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and inserting the following:

text.#text: by striking

For the academic year beginning on July 1, 2014, and for each of the 4 succeeding academic years, a
			 State shall—

maintain State support for institutions of higher education (not including support for capital
			 projects or research and development, or tuition and fees paid by
			 students) at least at the level of such support for the academic year
			 beginning on July 1, 2012; and

maintain State support for student financial aid for paying costs associated with postsecondary
			 education at least at the level of such support for the academic year
			 beginning on July 1, 2012.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subpart 4 of part A of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965

header.#text: Federal and State partnerships for college access, affordability, and completion

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to make incentive grants to States to assist
			 States in—

text.#text: It is the purpose of this subpart for the
providing subgrants to eligible institutions or consortia of eligible institutions—

to improve student outcomes, such as completion and transfer rates and workforce outcomes for
			 graduates; and
to develop and implement practices that result in reduced costs for students; and

providing public accountability and consumer information on the performance of institutions of
			 higher education operating within the State.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
. The agreement shall contain the following
			 assurances:

text.#text:
In order to be eligible to receive an incentive grant under this subpart, a State shall enter into
			 an agreement with the

Federal funds received by the State under this subpart will supplement and not supplant other
			 Federal and State funds otherwise available to carry out activities
			 described in this subpart.
The State will maintain its commitment to affordable higher education as described in
The State will fulfill its role in program integrity under
The State has a comprehensive plan for public postsecondary education that addresses the following:
Measurable goals for student outcomes, including enrollment, participation, and completion rates.
Measurable goals for college affordability in the State.
Alignment of such plan with the workforce and economic development plans of the State.
Alignment of such plan with the elementary and secondary education plan for the State.

The postsecondary educational needs of unserved and underserved individuals within the State,
			 including individuals beyond traditional college age.

The State provides for direct, equitable, and active participation by representatives of
			 institutions of higher education, including the voluntary participation of
			 private, nonprofit institutions of higher education, and other
			 stakeholders in the comprehensive planning process.
In this subpart:
The term
an institution of higher education;
an institution of higher education in partnership with—

a nonprofit or community-based organization that has demonstrated success in improving student
			 outcomes in postsecondary education; or
a local workforce investment board; or
a consortium of institutions of higher education.

text.#text:
In order to receive an incentive grant under this subpart, the State agency with jurisdiction over
			 higher education, or another agency or entity designated by the Governor
			 or chief executive of the State to administer the program under this
			 subpart, shall submit an application to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall contain—

text.#text: An application submitted under

a description of how grant funds will assist the State in meeting its goals for student outcomes,
			 including enrollment and completion;

a description of how grant funds will assist the State in meeting the postsecondary needs of
			 underrepresented or underserved populations in the State, including how
			 the State will use grant funds to strengthen the eligible institutions
			 described in

a description of how the State’s comprehensive plan for public higher education is aligned with the
			 workforce and economic development plans of the State;

a description of the process the State will use to make subgrants to eligible institutions or
			 consortia of eligible institutions, including eligible institutions
			 described in

a description of how the State will make publicly available a report card on the progress in
			 meeting State goals for public postsecondary education; and

a description of the stakeholder consultation, including efforts to engage the voluntary
			 participation of private, nonprofit institutions, carried out in the
			 development of the application.

header.#text: Payment of Federal share of grants

text.#text: A State awarded an incentive grant under this subpart—
shall use grant funds to award student grants; and
may use grant funds to award subgrants to eligible institutions.

A State awarded an incentive grant under this subpart shall establish a program to award grants to
			 students that complies with the following:
The program is administered by a single State agency.

short-title.#tail:
and that is eligible to participate in a program authorized under this title, shall be eligible to
			 participate under this paragraph.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Partnerships for Affordability and Student Success Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Partnerships for Affordability and Student Success Act

text.#text:
The program provides that an institution of higher education that had a student who received funds
			 under this subpart at any time beginning on July 1, 2010, through the day
			 before the date of enactment of the

The program provides that such grants to students will be in amounts not to exceed the student’s
			 cost of attendance per academic year for attendance at an institution of
			 higher education. Such grants, in combination with other State or Federal
			 student assistance, shall not exceed the student’s cost of attendance in
			 any given academic year.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and by the State.

text.#text:
The program provides for the selection of grant recipients on the basis of substantial financial
			 need determined under

The program provides for the payment of the non-Federal share of such grants from funds supplied by
			 such State which represent an additional expenditure for such year by such
			 State for grants for students attending institutions of higher education
			 over the amount expended by such State for such grants, if any, during the
			 second fiscal year preceding the fiscal year in which such State initially
			 received funds under this subpart.

The program provides that if the State’s allotment under this subpart is based, in part, on the
			 financial need demonstrated by students who are independent students or
			 attending the institution less than full time, a reasonable proportion of
			 the State’s allotment shall be made available to such students.

The program will notify students receiving grants under this subpart that such grants are
			 Federal–State partnership grants and are funded by the Federal Government
			 and the State.

A State awarded an incentive grant under this subpart may establish a program to award subgrants to
			 eligible institutions that complies with the following:
The program is administered by a single State agency.

The program provides for the selection of subgrant recipients based on criteria set by the State
			 agency.
The program provides for subgrants that support activities that will assist the State in achieving—

the State’s measurable goals for student outcomes, including enrollment, participation, and
			 completion rates for underrepresented or underserved populations;

the State’s measurable goals for college affordability, including innovative methods for reducing
			 costs;
improved workforce outcomes for graduates; and
the State’s measurable goals for strengthening the eligible institutions described in

The program provides for the dissemination of promising practices developed through subgrant
			 activities.
A State awarded an incentive grant under this subpart shall provide—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to perform the

's functions
			 under this subpart.

text.#text:
for the making of such reports, in such form and containing such information, as may be reasonably
			 necessary to enable the

shall
			 reserve from the applicable allotment (including any applicable

			 limits of such allotment or reallotment) shall be equal to the Federal
			 share of the cost of the grants to students or subgrants to eligible
			 institutions or consortia of such institutions covered by such
			 application.

text.#text: Upon approval of an application for an incentive grant under this subpart, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall pay such reserved amount, in advance or by way of reimbursement, and in such
			 installments as the
may determine.

text.#text: The

may amend the reservation of any amount under this subsection, either upon approval
			 of an amendment of the application or upon revision of the estimated cost
			 of the grants to students or subgrants to eligible institutions with
			 respect to which such reservation was made. If the

approves an
			 upward revision of such estimated cost, the

may reserve the
			 Federal share of the added cost only from the applicable allotment (or
			 reallotment) available at the time of such approval.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is equal to 66.66 percent.

text.#text: The Federal share of the cost of carrying out the activities described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

			 kind, fairly evaluated.

text.#text: For activities described in

header.#text: Certain activities for which non-Federal share may be provided in cash or In kind

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: on an annual basis:

text.#text:
A State that desires to receive payments for continuing incentive grants under this subpart shall
			 report the following information to the

The State's progress in meeting its goals for college affordability, including measures to minimize
			 tuition increases at public institutions and measures to increase the
			 availability of need-based student aid.

The State’s progress in meeting the postsecondary needs of underrepresented or underserved
			 populations in the State, including how the State is strengthening the
			 eligible institutions described in
A list of any subgrants made to eligible institutions.
The State’s report card described in

Each State that receives an allotment under this subpart shall report annually to the public on its
			 progress in meeting its public postsecondary education goals and
			 comprehensive plan for public higher education. Such report shall include—

information, as determined by the State in consultation with stakeholders, on workforce outcomes
			 for graduates;

information on college costs, including tuition increases, student indebtedness, and the
			 availability of need-based aid; and

information on the consumer complaints related to the performance of institutions of higher
			 education reported to the State in the prior year.

header.#text: Participation of private, nonprofit institutions of higher education

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . A State—

text.#text:
A private, nonprofit institution of higher education may voluntarily elect to participate in a
			 State's efforts under the plan described in
shall not require any private, nonprofit institution to participate in such efforts; and

may require such an institution that voluntarily elects to participate in such efforts to provide
			 appropriate information to allow the State to assess the institution's
			 progress towards the goals and activities described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall be
			 construed to—

text.#text: Nothing in this subpart, including voluntary participation described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, a State, or an officer or employee of the Department or of a State to
			 exercise any direction, supervision, or control over a private, nonprofit
			 institution of higher education, including control over curriculum,
			 program of instruction, administration, governance, personnel,
			 articulation, the awarding of credit, graduation or degree requirements,
			 or admissions;

text.#text: authorize the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, a State, or an officer or employee of the Department or of a State to
			 require a private, nonprofit institution of higher education to
			 participate in a longitudinal data system; or

text.#text: authorize the
limit the application of the

If any State fails or refuses to comply with any provision of this section, the State shall no
			 longer be eligible for assistance under this subpart.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text:
such sums as may be necessary for
			 fiscal year 2015 and each of the 4 succeeding fiscal years

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: There are authorized to be appropriated

text.#text:
Not less than 70 percent of funds allocated to a State shall be reserved for providing grants to
			 eligible students.

Not more than 8 percent of the funds allocated to a State may be used to provide public
			 accountability and consumer information on the performance of institutions
			 of higher education and for administering the grant.
